thread.title: Sources: Education Secretary Arne Duncan stepping down
thread.title_full: Sources: Education Secretary Arne Duncan stepping down

title: Sources: Education Secretary Arne Duncan stepping down
text:
Sources: Education Secretary Arne Duncan stepping down Education Secretary Arne Duncan is stepping down in December after 7 years in the Obama administration. Post to Facebook Sources: Education Secretary Arne Duncan stepping down Education Secretary Arne Duncan is stepping down in December after 7 years in the Obama administration.  //on.wusa9.com/1L8NwP7   Sources: Education Secretary Arne Duncan stepping down Associated Press, AP 11:26 a.m. EDT October 2, 2015 Arne Duncan, U.S. Secretary of Education, speaks at a press conference announcing that Starbucks will partner with Arizona State University to offer full tuition reimbursement for Starbucks employees to complete a bachelor's degree, on June 16, 2014 in New York City. The offer will be made to both full-time and part-time employees through online classes. (Photo by Andrew Burton/Getty Images) (Photo: Andrew Burton, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET   
WASHINGTON (AP) - Education Secretary Arne Duncan is stepping down in December after 7 years in the Obama administration. Duncan says in a letter to staff that he's returning to Chicago to live with his family. The letter was obtained by The Associated Press and confirmed by a White House official. The official wasn't authorized to comment by name and spoke on condition of anonymity. President Barack Obama is tapping Education Department official John King Jr. as acting secretary through the end of his term. But Obama is not nominating King to be secretary. King is currently serving as delegated deputy secretary. He oversees preschool through high school education and manages the department's operations. Obama plans to discuss the change in leadership Friday afternoon at the White House. Read or Share this story: http://on.wusa9.com/1L8NwP7 TOP VIDEOS
